item.title: Hindu saura mata
item.description: (This article was published by IndiaFacts in 2015) The Pantheon Of The Indian Saura Tradition The Indian Saura-mata (or the Hindu sect of the Sun) is an amalgam of two distinct layers 1: The endogenous layer of solar deities going back to the Veda and The neo-morphic layer of Iranic origin which was transferred to India as a result of contact with Zoroastrians and to an extent, non-Zoroastrian Iranians from a period spanning the beginning of the common era to the around the 6th -7th centuries of the common era.
